definitions.definition: an area of a city, especially a very poor area, where people of a particular race or religion live closely together and apart from other people:
examples: As a child she lived in one of New York's poorest ghettos.

definitions.definition: in the past, an area of a city where Jews were made to live
a part of society or group that is in some way divided from the main part:
examples: Brought up in what he describes as "a middle class ghetto", he imagined that all people were as privileged as he was.
